title: reksai, is strangely... balanced
body:
despite the fact that she is manaless.

she CAN deal damage if she chooses to build that way.. she CAN built tanky and just be used for CC and engage.. she can go anywhere in between

she is good enough to be picked in LCS but is beginner friendly enough for an easy clear because of her passive

@Riot please consider reksai as an example of a well designed jungle champ


EDIT: 
YES, i mean the CURRENT rek'sai

_Obviously_ release rek'sai  had crazy absurd ratios, but the point is to fix her they didn't have to change her KIT in any way.. just tweak some numbers

reksai is an impossible to balance abomination. too much mobility means a kit that's boring as hell. that line ball she shoots out, whatever it is? what does it do besides tickle the HP bars of the people it hits? seems like a useless ability like lucians starbust thingy and grave's gas grenade thingy. not too many melees have useless abilities like this because their kit has too much power elsewhere. 
not to mention, damn boring as hell to watch. hey im reksai, watch me flash unburrow. that's a cool combo right? then ima auto attack u as much as I can while i rely on my base stats to stay alive in the front line for ages.

Don't complain about Reksai when you literally have no clue how the hell her kit works. That "line-ball" thing is her burrowed Q. It is not her damage spell. It is a utility spell. It reveals enemies which is so damn important because when your burrowed you have only 160ish units of vision and Q lets you see them.

Her Q can be used to CS safely in top, scout out jungle camps, is surprisingly decent poke compared to her regeneration, near instant AOE damage that can help her clear and pick off extremely low health enemies, it gives her something to do while burrowed.

In a fight she has about the same mobility as Xin Zhao unless she planned well and set tunnels up. When people talk about how mobile she is, they mean map-mobility.

Saying Graves gas grenade is just silly, especially when you could have used Ezreal's W instead.

The real reason Rek'sai was a competitive staple is that she's a moving pink ward with decent ganks. Shes boring to watch, but fun to play due to how fluid she feels.
What do you mean moving pink Ward? Because she can see enemies who are stealthed?

She can see where everybody is in a huge radius without needing vision. In competitive this information is absolutely massive. Unfortunately though it leads to boring games because Rek'sai's team can never be ambushed.

Just adding onto this; Rek'sai can't see enemies who are standing completely still and are quite far away. (Like you said Arakadia she NEEDS Q to see enemies for ganks since she has little vision of them close up). So theoretically; YES her team can be ambushed if the enemy team stands in an unwarded bush WITHOUT anyone moving.
Not really an example of balanced, has a lot of mobility, tankiness, and damage. Really just a lot of damage though.

Or get both and be full tank

that's part of the reason why she is balanced... she CANT do full tank and deal any decent damage, and she cant go full damage and still be crazy tanky. she has to choose one. or something in between,  she isnt like {{champion:106}}  who can build full tank and be impossible to kill and still murder your entire team and do more damage than an adc

at least after he crazy release damage ratios were fixed to more realistic levels...
Rek'Sai is really weak outside of organized play...I don't know what you're smoking.
I mean unless you're a rock you can see you Rek'Sai going towards enemies while burrowed and KNOW she's gonna knock someone up.

And so can the enemy team. It's extremely 50/50 whether your team or the enemy team will follow up quicker in solo play, and if the enemy responds then Rek'Sai is stuck in the middle of 5 enemies with no escape. Not to mention that fact that her tremor sense is extremely limited in solo play and low divisions where teammates are not observant and don't have communication. Add to that the fact that she only has three damaging abilites, one of which is extremely weak and the other two are basically just auto attacks...so look at all this and then tell me that Rek'Sai is strong.

In organized play the enemy team also has a 50/50, so you're saying she's weak outside team play because...? In solo you're not supposed to use tremor sense to find people and ping them, you're not a UAV. It's for people hiding or on the other side of a wall so you can tunnel over said wall. In LCS I see people notice Rek'Sai and stand still (as 3+) and then jump her from a bush, it's much safer in solo play for her. And you could say Trynd is weak since he has ONE damaging skill. One of Rek'Sai's attacks is true damage and  one can find people over walls if she's burrowed. So yeah, I can look at all that and tell you Rek'Sai is strong.

You completely missed my point. Let me put it more simply: Rek'Sai has so much utility in the form of tremor sense that she has to be balanced around this factor for pro play. But for regular players, while it does have it's uses, is not nearly as impactful as it is in coordinated play.

 Let's say Rek'Sai has a power budget of 100 that's balanced around the pros. Her tremor sense is 50 when being used at max potential, leaving her other abilities at 50 in total. Well, in solo play since it's extremely difficult to use tremor sense to full potential, let's say its power level is 20. Therefore as a whole she is only at 70/100 because of the discrepancy in the value of tremor sense at pro levels versus regular play. This is the problem right here; that Rek'Sai is balanced around pro play first is what causes issues. 

I'm not saying Rek'Sai is a poorly designed champion; she just suffers from being designed to rely too heavily on team coordination, and that leads to the situation where she can't do as well in regular play.

you can make any champ sound weak w/ the way you explained it

rengar is extremely weak, it's a 50/50 they either react and you die a horrible death or you leap in and try and kill the adc, but they can outplay you so you can die anyways. your damaging abilities consist of an autoattack reset, some shit damage in an aoe, and a skillshot that's clunky to land. your ult has such a long cd that if you're not using it optimally then you cant do shit. he's only potent in low elos where you can get away without people seeing your indicator, and even then, you'll still have a chance to fail.

Why are you strawmanning his argument, when he actually makes valid points? Rek'sai is almost always forced to build tank, and at one point becomes a walking AoE knock-up. The only reason she's used in competitive is because she can provide ridiculous map pressure for her teammates when played correctly and with a team. In solo Q where everyone is expected to pull their own weight, she's far down in the pecking order as a good pick.

You seem to be implying that manaless champions are overpowered (or underpowered, but I'm guessing you don't mean that) and that Rek'Sai is the only actual balanced manaless champion. Manaless doesn't imply that something is strong or weak. A champion can be weak and manaless or strong and manaless. Manaless is a strong trait, but if other stats are kept in check then the champions who are manaless can be balanced.

i honesty have to disagree.
Reksai is overall rather weak, and the only thing that keeps her viable is a strong early and subtile utillity later on.
She's very similar to lee, even new players can clear decently and duel or gank rather well, but past the laneingphase she drops really hard unless you are a coordinated team and know how to make good use of her tremor-sens and map-mobillity, which leads to first time players haveing a 43% winrate only on her as you need to really make most of her early(ganking and clearing **decently **is by far not enough) and ideally also know **as a team** how to use her more subtile strengths later on.

Her scaleing into lategame fights is out right pathetic. If you go tank, you do no damage and have little cc, so your pretty ignorable after the initial knockup, if you go for damage you are way squishy for a pure melee champ with a rather delayed damage profile and poor in-fight mobillity so she just gets blown up befor she gets anything done unless she gets the **perfect** flank. If you go bruiser, you still get blown up while still haveing not that great damage.
Anything but tank is only useable for splitpush in higher elos.

While she might be overall balanced, she just doesn't really deliver on her fantasy(at least in higher elos), as fulltank is about the only viable way, so you turn from a furious voidbeast that tears stuff apart the first ~20 min into a mobile radar station with an occasional knockup.
And mobile radar station with knock up is not what i have in mind then i look at reksai...
She also has to much of her power focused on the early game, and to extreme power curves simply aren't great.
A good reksai is terror to face in the early game, just like a good lee, but if you survive for the first ~20 min without allowing her to snowball, she disapears into the dessert and doesn't bother anyone anymore, leaving her team on basically a 4 vs 5.
Release Rek, unborrow below ADC, and he dies before he Drops down
Well she has been nerfed accordingly. The OP wasn't claiming release rek sai was balanced
